_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Impermanence of senses [sn25.2:2.5]: sights are impermanent, perishing, and changing
sounds are impermanent, perishing, and changing
smells are impermanent, perishing, and changing
tastes are impermanent, perishing, and changing
touches are impermanent, perishing, and changing
thoughts are impermanent, perishing, and changing
Characteristics of the three types of fo: Arrived at inevitability regarding the right path
Arrived at the level of the good person
Transcended the level of the bad person
Can't do any deed which would make them be reborn in hell, the animal realm, or the ghost realm
Can't die without realizing the fruit of stream-entry.
